div.p: GRG 19/391, State Records of South Australia, Adelaide.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Undated fragment, probably from the consignment acknowledged in M to M. Holtze, 2 October 1890; all dated specimens in AVH are '1890'. M clearly did not report on this consignment in numerical order, but as, when he acknowledged the arrival, he wrote that intended to report on 'the best of what has just arrived and describe what is new', it is probable that the Utricularia no. 1176 was examined before M went to New Zealand in January 1891. This fragment is therefore dated to October 1890 as the earliest it could have been written.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;
p.seg: This date is still subject to change, so I have NOT amended the file name or

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: The translation is included in brackets within the text.

cell.p:
Acacia aulacocarpa
There is no specimen listed in AVH (accessed 25 July 2022) corresponding to this record number or name that is attributed to any of the Holtze family. (var.) Cunningham
Von Beiden sind Samen recht erwünscht, da diese Arten noch nicht in Cultur sind.
[Seeds are much desired of both, as these species are not yet in culture.]

cell.style: padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
cell.p:
Utricularia capilliflora F.v M.
Although the specimen (MEL 1513558) is attributed to M. W. Holtze in AVH, and M's label says 'Holtze' without further identification, when it was descrbed in B91.05.07, p. 176, M wrote that it was from 'On the Adelaide River; Mr. Holtze junior'.

p.seg: kleines Pflänzchen, von dem ich einen Vorrath zum Vertheilen u auch Frucht Ex. haben möchte. Hätten Sie nicht Ex. in Alcohol geschickt, würde es schwer gewesen sein, diese Art genau zu beschreiben. Sollten Sie künftig mir Blumen in Alcohol senden von Arten, die ich schon benannt, dann würde es am Besten sein, den
, indem das Durchgearbeitete in die grosse Normal Sammlung gewöhnlich bald inserirt wird, u. ich

div.p: [A new and wonderful little plant of which I would like to have a supply for distribution, as well as fruiting specimens. If you had not sent specimens in alcohol, it would have been difficult to describe this species accurately. Should you in future send me flowers in alcohol of species I have already named, it would be best to indicate the name , not the number, as the material I have worked through is usually inserted quickly into the general herbarium collections and I do not keep a numerical index of your plants.]
